definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: Several new plays will be performed on National Day.
sentences.chinese: 国庆日将上演几个新戏。

sentences.english: Fireworks burst over Ottawa's Rideau Canal in on honor of Canada's national birthday.
sentences.chinese: 烟花在渥太华运河上空绽放以庆祝加拿大国庆日。

sentences.english: The National Day is a designated date on which celebrations mark the nationhood of a nation or non-sovereign country.
sentences.chinese: 但是有一些国家没有特定的国庆日，例如英国。

sentences.english: Fireworks illuminate the skies of Taipei during the evening of the ROC National Day on Oct. 10.
sentences.chinese: 烟火于十月十日的国庆日照亮台北大稻埕的夜空。

sentences.english: Meets five meets for ten National Days, some also must expand the celebration scale.
sentences.chinese: 逢五逢十的国庆日，有的还要扩大规模的庆祝活动。

sentences.english: Today we celebrate our day of independence. It's a national holiday.
sentences.chinese: 今天我们庆祝国家独立节，这是国庆日。

definition: Eid al-Fitr or Feast of Breaking the Fast, celebrated on the last day of Ramadan
Liberation Day/cf Japan's surrender on 15th August 1945, celebrated as Liberation Day in Korea
Assumption of the Virgin Mary (Christian festival on 15th August)
Hanukkah (Chanukah), 8 day Jewish holiday starting on the 25th day of Kislev (can occur from late Nov up to late Dec on Gregorian calendar)/also called 哈努卡節|哈努卡节 and simply 哈努卡
see 古爾邦節|古尔邦节[Gu3 er3 bang1 jie2]
